titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frank Mullen Papers 1980-1986
titlestmt.author: James Feller

publicationstmt.publisher: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-07-11.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS 2nd Edition ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

did.abstract: This collection consists of papers related to the reelection campaigns of Congressman Thomas Foley from 1980 through 1986, gathered by Frank Mullen who served as the Whitman County coordinator of Foley's reelection campaign in these years.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of papers related to the reelection campaigns of Congressman Thomas Foley from 1980 through 1986, gathered by Frank Mullen who served as the Whitman County coordinator of Foley's reelection campaign in these years. It includes an analysis of the Fifth Congressional District, newspaper articles about Foley, and petitions of support.

bioghist.p: Thomas Foley (1929-2013) was born in Spokane, Washington and attended Gonzaga University and the University of Washington. He was first elected to Congress in 1964 and served the Fifth District of Washington State until 1995. He eventually became the Speaker of the House of Representatives. When he left Congress after being defeated by George Nethercutt in the 1994 midterm election, Washington State University created the Foley Institute of Public Policy and Public Service in his honor.
Frank Mullen was the Whitman County coordinator of Foley's reelection campaigns in the years 1980-1986.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

processinfo.p: James Feller processed this collection in 2018.

acqinfo.p: The Washington State University Foley Institute transferred this collection to the Washington State University Libraries in 1997 (MS.1997.23)
